page.title: 15CROSSGATES_LAST 20 YEARS_1
page.content: During the last 20 years,there have been a number of changes in and around Crossgates and Hallbeath.The main changes have been made in{industry}and {communications.}Previous to 1964,Fife was a region much cut off from the rest of Scotland,due to the River Forth.Traffic could only cross the river by the bridge at{Kincardine}much further up stream.This meant that traffic by passed the main area of the region,making industry very sparce due to the cost of transportation of materials and goods;But,in 1964 the{ {FORTH ROAD BRIDGE}was opened,providing excellent road links,and a flood of new industries taking advantage of the now prospering communication links. Although the motor way leading up to the bridge didn't go as far north as Crossgates,in 1967 it was extended ,just by_passing Crossgates.
